title: Set up and sample for intrumented unit tests
Regenerate Private Key from mobile client
body:
So we have a couple of problems:
1. User should generate Private Key every time when his password changed.
2. Normally to generate Private Key user has to do it manually from web->username->Personal.
3. iOS/android APIs not provide this functionality
4. iOS/android APIs not provide handle of error (when user should to regenerate Private Key manually before getting any respons from server), just common handle like UNHANDLED_HTTP_CODE | UNKNOWN_ERROR

title: Android 6 + ext Sdcard: no moving image after uploading
body:
### Expected behaviour

Taken image should be moved from ext sdcard to owncloud directory.
### Actual behaviour

Image is uploaded, but not moved to oc directory (only copied).
### Steps to reproduce
1. Enable "file will be moved to sdcard"
2. Use a camera app that stores the images on ext sdcard
3. take photo
4. verify that it is still on ext sdcard

This seems to be due to the new android 6 permission system:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/26744842/how-to-use-the-new-sd-card-access-api-presented-for-lollipop

As this is kind of a regression this should be handled with priority!
@davivel

Device model: Moto X Play

Stock or customized system: Cyanogenmod

ownCloud app version: 2.0.0

title: Dynamic chunk sizing for faster upload of big files
body:
### Expected behaviour

Big files should be easy to upload and should not stress server nor client as there should be moderate SQL activity (in contrast to notorious small file upload slowdown problems)
### Actual behaviour

In Android sync client big files (ten or hundreds of megabytes) are generally slow to upload. For example a 200 MB video starts off nicely at somewhat below connection limited speed but drops in about 1 minutes gradually to ~30% of the speed and further down. My server is powerful (4 cores, 4GB RAM etc.) and connection to the server is over wifi (real TCP throughput ~40 Mbit). Example: upload starts at ~25 Mbit/s. In 60 sec its down to 10 Mbit and in 120s its ~5-6 mbit (given that the file is big enough).
### Steps to reproduce
1. Upload at least 100 MB file over a connection where it takes > 1 min to upload.
2. Observe speed at network interface (Android or server side)

Can this problem be reproduced with the official owncloud server?
(url: https://demo.owncloud.org, user: test, password: test)
Cannot test - my outside uplink is too slow. I am using server ownCloud 8.2.3 (beta)  myself currently. Similar problems persisted with 8.1.
### SOLUTION

I recompiled the 1.9.1 source with one modification in file /owncloud-android-library/src/com/owncloud/android/lib/resources/files/ChunkedUploadRemoteFileOperation.java

> > public static final long CHUNK_SIZE = 1024000;
> > 
> > public static final long CHUNK_SIZE = 10240000; // added one "0", ~10M
### RESULT

Enormous speedup. My uploads go at ~40 Mbit/s and speed is not dropping !
So the problem is the CHUNK size that fragments the upload, and creates obviously comparably more SQL activity at server.

If you are interested in recompiled apk, ask me: sven(at)omapilv.ee
### RECOMMENDATION for FIX

Add possibility to change chunk size to 10M in settings. Choise is needed as some people may find it convenient to use 1M chunk for unstable connections (discussed in some threads). In wifi its usually not needed.
### Environment data

Android version:
5.1
Device model: 
One Plus X
Stock or customized system:
Stock
ownCloud app version:
1.9.1
ownCloud server version:
8.2.3

title: Resized images
body:
--------- edited by @davivel

**BLOCKED** by https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/16250

--------- edited by @jabarros
TASKs:
- [X] Changes after CR @jabarros
- [X] [QA] Create 'resizedImages' branch in QA Repo  @jesmrec
- [X] [QA] Merge 'resizedImages' branch in QA Repo
- [X] [QA] Create test plan @jesmrec 
- [ ] [QA] Validate test plan @jesmrec [WIP]

bugs and improvements:
- [ ] Unsupported image formats https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1599#issuecomment-229400874
- [ ] Bad preview of landscape images https://github.com/owncloud/android/pull/1599#issuecomment-229406324 @davivel [WIP]

---

This PR is now against master.

As this PR introduces a rather complex feature I will summarize it here.
- Clicking on an image loads a reduced version to the cache.
- The width and height is determinated by the screen.
- the benefit is a very small, but yet usable preview of the image.
- it can be used to send via whatsapp, or as a file to another app (like k9) with the correct filename.
- resized images are not treated as downloaded files. If the user wants to have the real file, he has to long-click and select download.
- clicking on an image shows first a square thumbnail (if available) until the resized image is loaded

**ToDo**
- Zooming a resized image with at least 2x (which can get blurry)
  - show snackbar "automatically download full image on zoom: yes"
  - Clicking "yes" after second time will offer option "always" to prevent showing the question. 
  - time out the snackbar the second time by just waiting will show "never download full image" -> "yes".
  - after both show second snackbar without action "default behaviour can be changed in settings"
- In setting: new entry "click on image downloads ..."
  - full image to storage
  - resized image to cache

title: Needed: Automatic or manual retry of failed instant upload
body:
It happens pretty often that my instant upload fails. I'm not quite sure why that is the case, it then just displays "Upload failed".

1) Is there a way to find out why it fails?
2) Regarding that an upload can fail for any reason (e.g. networking), it would be nice if the owncloud client retried uploading by itself or from time to time synchronises the instant upload directory with not yet uploaded files from the phone (those that failed, "really new ones" are being tried to upload) either automatically or manually (synchronize folder or so).
The current state on my Owncloud Client 1.9.1 on Cyanogenmod 12.1 is that the images that failed on uploading just never appear on the server and that I don't even seem to have a manual way to do it (except finding out by myself which images weren't uploaded and then select and upload them manually).

title: Synced Files disappear on Samsung Galaxy S6 every day
body:
### Expected behaviour

Files that were synchronized should stay on my smartphone until i delete them (local or remote)
### Actual behaviour

All files get deleted by Samsungs Smart Manager App every day (or even faster??). The app somehow recognizes the synchronized files as temporary files and cleans up storage as soon as a (unknown) limit is reached. The app can't be uninstalled/deactivated as it is a preinstalled system app by Samsung.
### Steps to reproduce
1. Synchronize a file/folder in the client
2. Start Smart Manager app and cleanup storage
3. All synced files are gone
### Environment data

Android version: 6.0.1

Device model: Samsung Galaxy S6

Stock or customized system: stock

ownCloud app version: 1.9.1

ownCloud server version: 9.0

title: Enhancement: Incorporate the new tag system introduced in OC 9.0
body:
### Expected behaviour

It would be very nice to be able to use the new tag system also in the android app both for filtering by tag and setting tags for a file. 

It might be a great enhancement especially for large folders with many files (like InstantUploads for example). Being able to work with tags here might bring the usability to yet another level.

The search button could be a magnifying glass icon situated between the name of the folder and the three dots on top right. Once pressed it would clarify that it provides searching through tags, provide a text input field and fetch available tags from the server (just like the web app does)

Setting tags could be done choosing an item form menu (would be available also when multiple files selected)
### Actual behaviour

None at the moment
### To think through

What would the behavior be when older OC servers are used and thus tag system is not provided by the server.
### P.S.

It is only a suggestion,and I am aware that priorities might be tough, but I at least tried to present the idea..

title: Use share-permissions webdav property
body:
https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/22834 is merged.

This introduces a new webdav property. `share-permissions`. This property contains an integer which is the max share-permissions. This will allow you to display to proper share permissions etc.

You can already start implementing this. For older ownClouds the property will return a 404. So you have to fall back to the current behaviour. But then once 9.1 is released all will magically work.

Path appears

title: Feature request: Auto-refresh file/directory listing
body:
At the moment I'm using owncloud android app 1.9.1 (via Stackstorage) but I'm missing out on a feature.

All folders I created and files I uploaded in the web/windows client are only visible when I manually refresh the directory (pull-down refresh) in app. For example, I create a directory structure like this in-browser:

Root
= Folder 1
== Folder 2
=== Folder 3

When I open my storage in the android app, I land up in root and there is no folder visible and the message "Nothing in here. Upload something!" is showing. I have to manually refresh the directory and then Folder 1 becomes visible. When I open Folder 1, it is empty again and I have to manually refresh to see Folder 2. The same for Folder 3.

A nice feature would be that the file/dir listing is automatically refreshed so I don't need to manually refresh the x.xxx folders I have in my storage. Not sure if it's a bug or a feature request, but I hope you guys can help out!

title: Need to view from server without downloading
body: Let's say I upload some images from my Android phone's photo gallery into a folder called "Uploads" on my ownCloud server. When I use the ownCloud app to view the Uploads folder, if I tap an image that I want to see, it gets automatically downloaded to my phone and put in a new folder named Uploads. Great... If I view 100 photos now I have 100 duplicate images on my phone wasting space. Seems to me the act of _downloading and saving_, as opposed to simply viewing the image on the server, should be an optional selection. For example long press on the image and choose Download from a popup menu.

2.- Take some pics
3.- Before the uploads are finished, switch the device wifi off
### ACTUAL BEHAVIOUR

Some uploads are moved to "Failed" and the others remains in "Current"
### EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR

title: Cache resized images on local deletion of an image
body:
Related to #1044 

When deleting an image locally on the phone the app should generate an resized image of it prior to deletion.
With that (if the cache is big enough) the images can still be shown by thumbnail/resized image without server interaction.

title: Upload files: automatically create thumbnail
body:
When uploading an image the app should automatically generate a thumbnail.
This enhances the UX as the app has only to generate thumbnails for files on the server when entering a folder.

body:

title: [Android]: could not establish a connection
body:
Hi,

after a chrash I wiped my tablet. After that I installed ownloud app and tried to connect with my owncloud server. After I entered the server address I get an error: could not establish a connection.
(in German: Konnte keine Verbindung aufbauen)
The connect button is grey,I can't connect to the server. Before the crash everything works fine.
If I enter the url in a browser I get the login on my server and everything is fine. Sync client on my pc althoug works without problems.

I use a Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 with Cyanogen Mod 11, and current owncloud app (Ver 1.9.1).

Owncloud-Server ist 8.2.2 on BananaPi with Debian Wheezy an nginx. SSL enabled, SSL certificate from LetsEncrypt.
I connect to the server with an DynDns Domain name like https://myDynDns.com:40000

title: Share link does not work properly
body:
### Expected behaviour

Shared link in clipboard
### Actual behaviour

Empty line in clipboard
### Steps to reproduce
1. Share file for user
2. Share file with public link
3. Relaunch owncloud app
4. Open share options, get share link for this file and past link in any textfield
### Environment data

Android version: 5.1.1

Device model: bacon

Stock or customized system: stock

ownCloud app version: 1.9.1

ownCloud server version: 9.0.0
### Additional info

Share link does not work properly when file already shared to any user on the server.
The problem is on 212 line of ShareActivity.java (v. 1.9.1)

`212 String link = ((OCShare) (result.getData().get(0))).getShareLink();`

In this case result data contains 2 shares. First - with type USER, and second - with type - PUBLIC_LINK, and in 0 index thats share does not contain sharelink, so link variable will be empty.

Little workaround, change this line to 

```
String link = "";
for(Object object :  result.getData()){
    OCShare shareLink = (OCShare) object;
    if(shareLink.getShareType().name().equalsIgnoreCase("PUBLIC_LINK")){
        link = shareLink.getShareLink();
        break;
    }
}
```

May be server must send public link share in first position, may be android client must check type for every shares, I don`t know. 
I'll wait for the official fix, as long as this solution works for me.
